item.title: FTSE 100 Falls as Fed's Rate Decision Weighs
item.description: The FTSE 100 fell 0.2% after the Fed signalled it could deliver two more interest rate increases this year even as it paused its rate rise cycle.

item.title: Oil Inches Higher After Fed Moves to Pause Rate Hikes
item.description: Crude prices edged up in Europe clawing back some of the losses following the Fed’s decision, with Peak Trading calling it a “hawkish pause,” which “puts a floor under the dollar, a headwind for commodity markets.”

item.title: China Cuts Rates to Prop Up Flagging Recovery
item.description: The Chinese central bank’s latest interest-rate cut signals Beijing is increasingly uneasy about the economy’s prospects.

item.title: ECB's New Inflation Forecasts Could Move Euro
item.description: A widely expected interest rate rise by the ECB is unlikely to move the euro much, but new inflation forecasts could have a major impact, Commerzbank said.

item.title: Metals Prices Sink After Fed Indicates More Rate Hikes Possible, Despite Wednesday's Pause
item.description: Base metals and gold fell more than 1% in Europe, in reaction to the Fed indicating more rate hikes were possible this year.

item.title: German Two-Year Schatz Seen Offering Value Above 3% Yield
item.description: Mizuho said the ECB’s rate-rising cycle is mostly done and it sees value in fading any selloff that might materialise in front-end EUR rates after Thursday’s policy meeting and in the coming weeks.

item.title: Hugo Boss Upgrades 2023, Midterm Targets
item.description: Hugo Boss forecast 10%-20% earnings growth this year and raised its financial targets through 2025, thanks to strong sales in Asia-Pacific and especially China.

item.title: Siemens Plans Asia Production Expansion
item.description: Siemens said it planned to invest €2 billion to boost manufacturing capacity this year to tap growth opportunities in digitalization and automation and after experiencing “significantly above-market growth.”

item.title: Legal & General Names Santander Executive as New CEO
item.description: Legal & General has appointed Antonio Simoes as its incoming chief executive officer effective Jan. 1 2024.

item.title: H&M Sales Rise But Miss Forecasts
item.description: H&M second quarter sales rose by 6% on year but were “flattish” in local currencies, affected by unfavourable weather conditions, but said June had got off to a good start.

item.title: Japan in Talks to Provide Artillery Shells to U.S. to Boost Stocks for Ukraine
item.description: A global hunt for shells has intensified as Ukraine presses its counteroffensive against Russia, but Japan has long curbed exports of lethal weapons.

item.title: Chinese Property Shares Rise Despite Cooler Home Prices
item.description: Shares of Chinese property stocks rose, buoyed by hopes for more interest rate cuts, despite data showing a further slowdown in China’s real-estate market.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Sought to Push Oil Prices Higher. Markets Had Other Ideas.
item.description: Higher-than-expected production and concern about slowing demand have been weighing on crude.

item.title: The Shoulder-Fired Missile Making a Comeback
item.description: The Starstreak missile will re-enter production, but a long lead time shows the challenges of Western rearmament.

item.title: Southern Baptists overwhelmingly reaffirmed a prohibition on women serving as pastors, rebuffing one of their most prominent ministers.
item.description: Southern Baptists overwhelmingly reaffirmed a prohibition on women serving as pastors, rebuffing one of their most prominent ministers.

item.title: Yields on shorter-term U.S. government bonds reversed earlier declines Wednesday, with the two-year Treasury note settling at 4.707%, up from 4.694% Tuesday.
item.description: Yields on shorter-term U.S. government bonds reversed earlier declines Wednesday, with the two-year Treasury note settling at 4.707%, up from 4.694% Tuesday.

item.title: West Coast dockworkers reached a tentative labor deal with port employers following more than a year of contentious negotiations that have disrupted trans-Pacific trade.
item.description: West Coast dockworkers reached a tentative labor deal with port employers following more than a year of contentious negotiations that have disrupted trans-Pacific trade.

item.title: Europe's top antitrust regulator said it might seek the breakup of Google's ad-tech business as it charged the tech giant with abusing its dominance of the online advertising technology industry.
item.description: Europe’s top antitrust regulator said it might seek the breakup of Google’s ad-tech business as it charged the tech giant with abusing its dominance of the online advertising technology industry.

item.title: Nearly three dozen U.S. senators wrote a letter to Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, expressing their "profound anger and concern" over his detention by the Russian government.
item.description: Nearly three dozen U.S. senators wrote a letter to Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, expressing their “profound anger and concern” over his detention by the Russian government.

item.title: The Biden administration is setting the stage for large companies to start buying clean-energy tax credits, kick-starting a new market at the core of last year's climate law.
item.description: The Biden administration is setting the stage for large companies to start buying clean-energy tax credits, kick-starting a new market at the core of last year’s climate law.
